title: Turkey launches Northern Syria military operation with airstrikes
text:
By Jonathan Powell in London | chinadaily.com.cn | Updated: 2019-10-09 21:32

Turkey has launched its military operation in Northern Syria in the afternoon on Wednesday, with airstrikes hitting the border town of Ras al Ain.

Turkish troops started to mass on the Syrian border after the White House announced it was pulling US troops out of the region.

Turkish president, Recep Tayyip Erdogan, confirmed a military operation had begun, with Kurdish forces currently in control of the area reporting airstrikes and "huge panic".

In a Twitter post on Wednesday, Erdogan said:"Our aim is to destroy the terror corridor which is trying to be established on our southern border and to bring peace to the region.

"The Turkish Armed Forces, together with the Syrian National Army, just launched #OperationPeaceSpring against PKK/YPG and Daesh [Isis] terrorists in northern Syria. Our mission is to prevent the creation of a terror corridor across our southern border, and to bring peace to the area."

A spokesman for the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces (known as SDF) said shortly after the announcement that Turkish warplanes had already begun attacking the region, creating a "huge panic among people".
